title: What is the fascination expérimentale and how does Donato’s method differ from hypnosis and mesmerism?
first_phrase: This text is about the experiments conducted by Donato on the experimental fascination. Donato was able to have a very strong influence on his subjects, making them follow him everywhere, even if they resisted at first. In this part of the text, Donato is performing an experiment on Mr. Tanner. Despite the doctors' objections that the subject is not resisting enough, Donato succeeds in making him walk and even strike himself. Donato proves that the action of the gaze is not necessary, as he can achieve his results by standing behind the subject. The text also discusses the confusion between different phenomena that may look the same, but have different causes.
